answers.author: Julie Edmonds-Mares
answers.text:
Hi Pam,
Prompted by significant budget challenges, and with the goal of preserving the highest level of park maintenance service for residents at the lowest possible cost, the City of San Jose outsourced routine maintenance at small parks and civic grounds last year.  Prior to doing so we conducted a service delivery evaluation to compare in-house cost to outsourcing.  That study can be located here:
http://www.sanjoseca.gov/budget/FY1112/05MBA/MBA41-AlternateServiceDeliveryProposals-ParksLandscapeandCustodialServices.pdf
In addition, we also prepared a very detailed RFP to identify a vendor, which I can provide via email.    
I should also note, the cities of Roseville and Brentwood CA have also outsourced park maintenance for a longer period of time and staffs from those organizations were very helpful in the research stage of our evaluation.   
Feel free to pass on my contact information.
Julie

answers.author: Scott Dadson
answers.text:
We outsource this service in two ways; first, our downtown has a wonderful park (high maitiannce) and is a historic district, so combined is this contract.  Our second is a split workload between in-house staff and contractors (each leveraging their assets) for right of way (sidewalks, stormwater, linear parks, and medians) and pocket, neighborhood and regional parks.  www.cityofbeaufort.org

answers.author: Joseph Manning
answers.text:
Maplewood NJ contracts out for all our large field mowing. This is basically all our parks and the town hall. We've been doing it for almost four years and it has saved us a lot of money. Before we had in-house staff doing it and it took too much time. Our next door town liked the idea and so did our Board of Education and for the last three years we have jointly bid out the mowing services.
